result.execSummary:
The defendant E'keyra D Linsy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid at $50 per month commencing 01-04-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 10 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations and not prior to 11-01-2016.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Attorney Bryan C. Bayer appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Defendant E'keyra D Linsy in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 3.
Count 4 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $452.00
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 01/04/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: 7 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.  

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations and not prior to 11/01/16 and by application.

Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant E'keyra D Linsy in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant E'keyra D Linsy in court with attorney Tedia K. Gamino by Atty. Nicole Buttery.
Defense just received discovery and a pretrial offer.
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with co actors victim/witness or Burlington Coat Factory in the City of Brookfield listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant E'keyra D Linsy in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
